reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Preventing and Reducing Child Labor and Forced Labor in Palm Oil Supply Chains

description.narrative: Advocacy for international labour standards, labour law, fundamental principles and rights at work (child labour, forced labour, non-discrimination in the workplace, freedom of association and collective bargaining); formalisation of informal work, occupational safety and health.

This award supports advocacy for international labor standards, labor law, fundamental principles and rights at work. More specifically, this includes This project works to improve the implementation of social compliance systems that promote acceptable conditions of work and the prevention and reduction of child and forced labor in palm oil supply chains in Colombia and Ecuador. It will also disseminate best practices in social compliance systems in these and other palm oil producing countries, particularly Brazil and Peru.. This project works to improve the implementation of social compliance systems that promote acceptable conditions of work and the prevention and reduction of child and forced labor in palm oil supply chains in Colombia and Ecuador. It will also disseminate.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Quarterly disbursements by project. May include disbursements for: salary and benefits, travel and per diem, logistical expenses and other costs of delivering technical assistance.
